page.title: 17Kilgetty Coal Yard.
page.content: We spoke to Carolyn Hargrave and Mr. Thomas the manager. Coal used to be brought to the yard by rail and this finished in l964. There was also a Cattle Market near there which closed some l5 years ago. Coal is now brought from England and Wales to the yard by lorry. Their coal round extends from Carmarthen to Angle. l2 people work there. They do a door to door service. Most people buy about 3 tons per year in total but may buy 5 l cwt. bags at a time. Some 'phone to order coal but they also call in houses on a regular basis. The last years miners strike did not affect them because they are an N.C.B. company. Gypsies from Kilgetty common for example Mr. Probert aged 86 pushes a pram to collect coal. They sell about l50 tons per week. They have about ll types of coal.
